bibl.title: Broderick v Haller. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington 3d Judicial District Agust Term AD 1857
To the How_ 7 A Cehwa_ with one_ of the Justices of the Spokane Court_ of the United States for the territory of Washington.

The complainant McChad Broderick of ___ in the conty of Jefferson coould_ respectfully represent too your Honor for ___ on behalf of five men whose names are to your complement_ unknown_ but_ to the best of his know_ feeling and belief_ are subjects of her Majesty ____ ____ of Great Britan and late ____ on board of her Mejesty ship Sotatile_ are now unlawfully restrained of there liberty at Port ___ at the ___________Port by order of Mayor George, H. Haller on __ of the Unites States ____

That your complainant knowns of no cause or ___ of said ___ ___ cept the alleged charge of desertion on there part from home her Magesties ship sat a lite c____ in the Harbor of Port Lousesend_ that your c___ law believes the ____ to be illegal and ___ og authority of law, that your complainant belives that the afoe_ said two men died not doesnot said ship not bene engaged in malacy_ or right foot that they were ledt the space by the off___ of said ship stated to your complainant ___ therfore pray your Honor and were ____ the _______ after the departure of said ship ___ from the water of the ___

An issue of writ of Habias Corpus Commanding the ___ George G Haller to have the ___ said fice men whose remains are unknown to your complement boot to hom your complenet belives to be ___ of her Magesty +++ law of Great Brittan and lots ________ on board of her Magestys _____m before your Honor together with the cause of detention and your complainant will ____ pray
Sworn to before me this 13th day of July 1857
Filed in my ofice in ___ J.C. 13th day of July 1857 J.___ Dist Clerk
NOw/O Ex Forth Five Men Habeas Corpus July 13 1857
